column4: does anyone know what i'm doing wrong with regards to compiling my own kernels? why i run a custom kernel, the system seem's to lag, like it's under high load.
well you have to tell us a little more info then that, what kernel, what patches, what scheduler.. ?
not sure which scheduler, I think I left that as the default ubuntu config. the only patch I applied was an inotify patch, to vanila 2.6.10 sources
which ubuntu config? hoary or warty
warty. i copied the 2.6.8 config to the 2.6.10 directory, then did make oldconfig
ok webby, does it seem to lag only in X?
terminal seems fine, but haven't done much testing
I've got the fglrx driver installed for my old kernel, but not this one yet
why dont you try and compile for this kernel to elimate that issue, might just be cause X is in VESA mode (slow as hell)
does the ati driver use vesa? I thought that driver was ok
no ATI driver uses its own kernel mods, VESA only used if all else fails
but it has to be compiled against the running kernel to work
ok, so build the kernel module then?
